definition: to look at/to watch/to observe/to behold/to advise/concept/point of view/outlook
surname Li/abbr. for 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4], Classic of Rites

sentences.english: For just a few minutes he sat on a rostrum overlooking Tien An Men Square to watch a fireworks display.
sentences.chinese: 在观礼台上坐了几分钟观看天安门广场的烟火表演。

sentences.english: We observe that salute of American comrades, land and sea.
sentences.chinese: 我们观礼看致敬来自美国伙伴，陆海战。

sentences.english: There are only a few at the funeral home and at the graveside .
sentences.chinese: 不论是丧礼，或是落土仪式，都没有多少观礼的人。

sentences.english: It's a great spot to watch the monthly changing-of-guards ceremony at the Istana.
sentences.chinese: 它是观礼每月一次的总统府卫兵换班仪式的胜地。

sentences.english: For the erection of temporary viewing stand and bleachers.
sentences.chinese: 用于搭设临时的观礼台和看台。

definition: to congratulate respectfully/to express good wishes
congratulate an elderly person on his birthday/offer birthday felicitations
to offer birthday congratulations (to an elderly person)
to attend a meeting as a nonvoting delegate
pay an official call/call on/visit in an official capacity
